summary.para: The BNSharp.Plugins namespace contains interfaces that can be implemented to extend intrinsic BN# functionality. By implementing these interfaces and then registering the appropriate objects with BN#, many changes to the core functionality could be made, such as adding support for realm server connections, changing the login sequence, or implementing Warden.

BN# can be instructed to parse packets at different priorities. For example, supposing a moderation client wants to handle User Joined events immediately. By implementing IPacketPriorityProvider, your client can register custom priorities for ChatEvent packets, which permit them to be handled sooner when multiple packets are in the parsing queue. They can also be parsed manually by registering a custom ParseCallback. Custom parsers are expected to behave by maintaining their references in the chain and calling handlers higher up the chain when appropriate.
For more information augmenting BN#'s functionality with extensions, take a look at the JinxBot Wiki, including the article Custom packet handling with BN#.
